item.title: Job 1
item.description: v1 There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job.

item.title: Job 2
item.description: v1 Again, on the day when God’s sons came to present themselves before Yahweh, Satan came also among them to present himself before Yahweh.

item.title: Job 3
item.description: v1 After this Job opened his mouth, and cursed the day of his birth.

item.title: Job 4
item.description: v1 Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered, v2 “If someone ventures to talk with you, will you be grieved?

item.title: Job 5
item.description: v1 “Call now; is there any who will answer you? To which of the holy ones will you turn?

item.title: Job 6
item.description: v1 Then Job answered, v2 “Oh that my anguish were weighed, and all my calamity laid in the balances!

item.title: Job 7
item.description: v1 “Isn’t a man forced to labor on earth? Aren’t his days like the days of a hired hand?

item.title: Job 8
item.description: v1 Then Bildad the Shuhite answered, v2 “How long will you speak these things?

item.title: Job 9
item.description: v1 Then Job answered, v2 “Truly I know that it is so, but how can man be just with God?

item.title: Job 10
item.description: v1 “My soul is weary of my life. I will give free course to my complaint.

item.title: Job 11
item.description: v1 Then Zophar, the Naamathite, answered, v2 “Shouldn’t the multitude of words be answered?

item.title: Job 12
item.description: v1 Then Job answered, v2 “No doubt, but you are the people, and wisdom will die with you.

item.title: Job 13
item.description: v1 “Behold, my eye has seen all this. My ear has heard and understood it.

item.title: Job 14
item.description: v1 “Man, who is born of a woman, is of few days, and full of trouble.

item.title: Job 15
item.description: v1 Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered, v2 “Should a wise man answer with vain knowledge, and fill himself with the east wind?

item.title: Job 16
item.description: v1 Then Job answered, v2 “I have heard many such things.

item.title: Job 17
item.description: v1 “My spirit is consumed. My days are extinct, and the grave is ready for me.

item.title: Job 18
item.description: v1 Then Bildad the Shuhite answered, v2 “How long will you hunt for words?

item.title: Job 19
item.description: v1 Then Job answered, v2 “How long will you torment me, and crush me with words?

item.title: Job 20
item.description: v1 Then Zophar the Naamathite answered, v2 “Therefore my thoughts answer me, even by reason of my haste that is in me.

item.title: Job 21
item.description: v1 Then Job answered, v2 “Listen diligently to my speech. Let this be your consolation.

item.title: Job 22
item.description: v1 Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered, v2 “Can a man be profitable to God?

item.title: Job 23
item.description: v1 Then Job answered, v2 “Even today my complaint is rebellious.

item.title: Job 24
item.description: v1 “Why aren’t times laid up by the Almighty? Why don’t those who know him see his days?

item.title: Job 25
item.description: v1 Then Bildad the Shuhite answered, v2 “Dominion and fear are with him.

item.title: Job 26
item.description: v1 Then Job answered, v2 “How have you helped him who is without power!

item.title: Job 27
item.description: v1 Job again took up his parable, and said, v2 “As God lives, who has taken away my right, the Almighty, who has made my soul bitter

item.title: Job 28
item.description: v1 “Surely there is a mine for silver, and a place for gold which they refine.

item.title: Job 29
item.description: v1 Job again took up his parable, and said, v2 “Oh that I were as in the months of old, as in the days when God watched over me;

item.title: Job 30
item.description: v1 “But now those who are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I considered unworthy to put with my sheep dogs.

item.title: Job 31
item.description: v1 “I made a covenant with my eyes, how then should I look lustfully at a young woman?

item.title: Job 32
item.description: v1 So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

item.title: Job 33
item.description: v1 “However, Job, please hear my speech, and listen to all my words.

item.title: Job 34
item.description: v1 Moreover Elihu answered, v2 “Hear my words, you wise men.

item.title: Job 35
item.description: v1 Moreover Elihu answered, v2 “Do you think this to be your right, or do you say, ‘My righteousness is more than God’s,’

item.title: Job 36
item.description: v1 Elihu also continued, and said, v2 “Bear with me a little, and I will show you; for I still have something to say on God’s behalf.

item.title: Job 37
item.description: v1 “Yes, at this my heart trembles, and is moved out of its place.

item.title: Job 38
item.description: v1 Then Yahweh answered Job out of the whirlwind, v2 “Who is this who darkens counsel by words without knowledge?

item.title: Job 39
item.description: v1 “Do you know the time when the mountain goats give birth?

item.title: Job 40
item.description: v1 Moreover Yahweh answered Job, v2 “Shall he who argues contend with the Almighty?

item.title: Job 41
item.description: v1 “Can you draw out Leviathan with a fish hook, or press down his tongue with a cord?

item.title: Job 42
item.description: v1 Then Job answered Yahweh, v2 “I know that you can do all things, and that no purpose of yours can be restrained.
